name: Intimidation
description: When you attempt to influence someone through overt threats, hostile actions, or physical violence, the DM might ask you to make a Charisma (Intimidation) check. Examples include trying to pry information out of a prisoner, convincing street thugs to back down from a confrontation, or using the edge of a broken bottle to convince a sneering vizier to reconsider a decision.
typicalUses: Make a hostile creature think twice about attacking
Demand compliance through implied or overt threat
Break a prisoner's will to resist questioning
